xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
This module defines a function to check if an integrity constraint is satisfied. The integrity constraint needs to be declared in the prolog of a module.
This module is part of Zorba's XQuery Data Definition Facility. All the integrity constraints managed by this module have to be pre-declared in the prolog of a module. Please refer to the general documentation for more information and examples.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: Nicolae Brinza, Matthias Brantner, David Graf, Till Westmann, Markos Zaharioudakis

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Checks if the specified constraints are valid in the database.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $name The name of the integrity constraint to check.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: true if the constraints are valid; false otherwise.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: zerr:ZDDY0031 if the integrity constraint is not declared.
zerr:ZDDY0032 if the integrity constraint is not available.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: icdml:check-integrity-constraint
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function icdml:check-integrity-constraint($name as xs:QName) as xs:boolean external
